III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Title Youth nutrition
Rule Code & Section CCI Rule 400.4149
Description (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious
edible meals daily unless medically contraindicated and
documented.
Violation Type Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Allegation On 6/5/2024, Youth A was not provided a vegan option
for a meal. A Supervisor made a comment that the
youth would not eat as a result.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned
on 07/11/2024.
Complainant was contact on 07/12/2024 via telephone,
no additional information was provided.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 07/12/2024.
Director reported Youth A has been at the facility for two
months and he is very familiar with Youth A, but he is
not aware that Youth A is vegan. He said if Youth A was
vegan the facility would have accommodated his diet.
He is not aware of any incidents or reports that Youth A
was not provided a vegan meal. Director provided a
copy of the menu for the month of June. The menu does
state meal substitutes for legitimate resident specific
diet or allergies.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 07/12/2024.
Youth has been at the facility for almost two months and
is placed on pod 5. Youth A denied he is a vegan. Youth
A said last month he was trying to lose weight and
requested vegan meals. Youth A reported he was
provided substitute meals like mac and cheese and
peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. Youth A said he is
back to eating nonvegan meals. Youth A denied any
concerns regarding staff or supervisors making a
comment or not providing him with meals. Youth A said
all his needs are being met and he feels safe at the
facility.
2

Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 07/12/2024.
Youth B has been at the facility for 4 months and is
placed on pod 5. Youth B denied hearing staff make a
comment about Youth A not wanting to eat his meal.
Youth B reported the facility provides three meals
including fruit, snacks, and juice. Youth B said all his
needs are being met and expressed no concerns
regarding the facility or staff.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 07/12/2024.
Therapist has been working at the facility for 5 years.
Therapist has weekly therapy sessions with Youth A
and Youth A has never expressed any concerns
regarding staff or not being provided a vegan meal.
Therapist has reviewed Youth A’s intake paperwork and
there is no documentation that Youth A is a vegan and
Youth A has never reported to be vegan.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 07/25/2024 via
Teams call. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A is not
a vegan and Youth A has never expressed any
concerns regarding the facility not providing meals or
concerns for staff members.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on
08/14/2024. Supervisor reported she is familiar with
Youth A and is not aware of him being vegan.
Supervisor denied making a comment to Youth A or
denying any youth a meal specific to their diet.
Supervisor reported the facility provides youth with
substitute meals if they have a specific diet or allergies.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/14/2024.
Staff 1 has been working at the facility for one year.
Staff said she is not aware of Youth A being a vegan.
She said if a youth wants to substitute a meal, staff do
have the option to offer youths peanut butter
sandwiches, granola bars, or vegan sides. Staff 1
denied hearing Supervisor make any comments to
Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A intake forms dated 05/14/2024. No notes
specific to Youth A being a vegan.
• Facility weekly menus for the month of June.
Breakfast: mini pancakes, milk, banana, yogurt.
3

Lunch: taco salad, beans, cheese, Mexican rice,
milk. Dinner: pepper steak, rice, blended veggies,
applesauce, and milk.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted with staff and youth, no
violation is found. Youth A denied being a vegan, not
being provided with requested meals, or having
concerns regarding the facility or staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
